title.narrative: EA 13/2020 Emergency and Recovery Assistance to Cyclone Amphan Affected People in Bangladesh

description.narrative:
The super Cyclone “Amphan” formed in the Bay of Bengal and made landfall at Satkhira with wind speed 130-140 kph at 5 pm on 20 May 2020 after crossing west Bengal-Khulna coast near Sundarbans. The Cyclone hit Rajshahi-Pabna regions passing through Khulna, Jashore and Jhinaidah with wind speed 96-110 kph. The main impacts of the Cyclone are as follows- * About 2.6 million people of 76 upazilas under 19 districts in Khulna, Barishal and Rajshahi divisions in Bangladesh were affected. * At least 26 people were killed due to uprooted of trees, wall and houses collapsed and boat capsized. * Nearly 55,767 houses destroyed out of total 205,368 damaged, destroyed 32,037 hectares of standing crops, vegetables and fruits; damaged 18,707 hectares of shrimp and fish cultivation plots and died 14,268 of livestock. * Damaged 440 kilometers roads, 76 kilometers of embankments, 40,994 toilets and 18,235 tube-wells by the Cyclone Amphan and storm surges. *According to a primary estimate, the cyclone caused damage worth around Tk 1,100 crore (BDT 11 billion).
For this project Caritas Bangladesh will provide emergency and early recovery support for six months to address food insecurity, hygiene and shelter needs in eight unions under four upazilas of three districts in Khulna, Satkhira and Patuakhali for a total of 2,040 households (10,200 individuals).
